DataElement.preferredName: Colorectal Malignant Neoplasm Recurrent Cancer Progression Assessment Anatomic Site Other Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the other specified free-text field related to an anatomic site related to the worsening of a cancer over time or the recurrent disease (tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues) having to do with the colon or the rectum.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Colorectal Malignant Neoplasm Recurrent Cancer Progression Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the worsening of a cancer over time or the recurrent disease (tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues) having to do with the colon or the rectum.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (ko-lo-REK-tul) Having to do with the colon or the rectum.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: Relating to the colon and rectum, or to the entire large bowel.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: occurring again.:The worsening of a cancer over time.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: A pathologic process in which alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant neoplasm.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the other specified free-text field related to an anatomic site.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
